reviews.review: There were a few parts of the movie that seemed a little rushed.  The story itself didnt disappoint and stayed true to Star Wars.  My son and I really enjoyed it.

My only major complaint about the film is that the first act (especially the first 15-20 minutes) feels hugely rushed. The pacing is jarring. It's like actors run into frame, deliver lines, then find/do whatever they need to advance the story, then run back out.

With that out of the way though it provided a good conclusion to the previous films and some good wrap-ups for some beloved characters. The fan service is nice, but gets to be a little much but it's a very minor complaint.

After Rian Johnson's The Last Jedi, which made such bold choices and really broke from the mold (and the ensuing backlash by the neckbeards) I was afraid that JJ Abrams would make another vague fluffy mess like The Force Awakens, but despite him having a tendency to vastly under-explain things (like George Lucas) it was still a thoroughly enjoyable film once you get past the pacing issues early on.

It doesn't have the stark cinematic beauty of Last Jedi (watch it in black and white. it's a friggin' modern-day Akira Kurosowa film!) it was still very well done and while it might not have the instantly iconic scenes the previous film had (Holdo maneuver and duel on the salt pan anyone?!) it still does Star Wars justice by being visually interesting, moreso than Force Awakens I feel.

It could have been better if they'd let Rian Johnson do it, or at least kept him on as an advisor for the scene composition and cinematography (apparently he's amazing at it) but JJ (mostly) did good by the beloved franchise.

It's a fun ride and in the end that's what matters most with a movie like this.
It was good but definitely could have been better.

If you have the same amount of knowledge about star wars lore as a potato or just hate all the six first movies and what they stand for I would actually recommend the rise of skywalker as it is a pretty fun movie when you look past its enormous pile of lore mistakes
A fulfilling end to The Skywalker Saga!
Thank You JJ for making Star Wars one with the force once again....

Its better than the last jedi but not by much.

Think this one is going to be marmite (Love it or hate it)

For me the new Disney  cannon is crap, Star wars ended with episode 6, 7-9 not something I am going to watch again and again.

Spoiler
Visually (except  space horses) stunning, music great as always, plot /cameos  of every past jedi/cast member/planet not for me.
It was amazing I have just watched it and the scene where amazing creating a brilliant film it defiantly deserves a higher critic rating best in this saga
Excellent. Any true Star Wars fan will love this film and final chapter in the Skywalker story. But this is not even close to the end of Star Wars!!!  Much more coming in the future!!!
Loose story. Was not tied up properly.
